anatomic_course.origin: Lateral marginal vein of foot, posterior to lateral malleolus
anatomic_course.mid_calf: Enters saphenous compartment between gastrocnemius heads
anatomic_course.upper_calf: Within saphenous compartment, posterior to gastrocnemius

location_variability.high: May extend to mid-thigh before joining deep system
location_variability.absent: 10-20% have no true SPJ, drain via Giacomini vein

saphenopopliteal_junction.giacomini_vein: Cranial extension connecting SSV to GSV in posterior thigh

sural_nerve.course: Medial and lateral sural cutaneous nerves converge mid-calf to form sural nerve
sural_nerve.proximity: Runs closely with SSV in lower calf
sural_nerve.injury_risk: Thermal ablation without tumescent anesthesia risks injury

anatomic_relationships.popliteal_vessels: SSV crosses superficial to popliteal vessels at SPJ
anatomic_relationships.gastrocnemius: SSV lies between the two heads

anatomic_variants: True SPJ absent (drains via Giacomini vein) - 10-20%
presentation: Symptoms with standing, relief with elevation
Ankle flare (corona phlebectatica) on lateral ankle
Posterior calf skin changes (less common than GSV)
diagnosis: Map SPJ location (measure from popliteal crease)
Document sural nerve location if visible
treatment: Tumescent anesthesia mandatory for thermal ablation (nerve protection)
Foam sclerotherapy alternative for smaller SSV
Consider non-thermal ablation to reduce nerve injury risk

definition.@value: The superficial vein of the posterior calf originating from the lateral marginal vein, ascending in the saphenous compartment, and terminating at the highly variable saphenopopliteal junction, with critical proximity to the sural nerve.

sources.source: Harrison's Principles of Internal Medicine, 21st ed. McGraw-Hill.

learning_objectives: Trace SSV course from foot to SPJ
Describe the relationship of SSV to sural nerve
Apply preoperative mapping for SSV procedures
clinical_pearls: SPJ location is HIGHLY variable - ALWAYS map with ultrasound before intervention
Sural nerve injury causes numbness on lateral foot and heel
Giacomini vein connects SSV to GSV - present in up to 20% as primary drainage
Use tumescent anesthesia for thermal SSV ablation to protect sural nerve
Position catheter 2-3cm from SPJ to protect popliteal vein

medicalCode.description: Asymptomatic varicose veins of unspecified lower extremity
